channel.title: Ubuntu java problem
channel.description: I'm trying to install the java plugin into firefox on ubuntu, when the java plugin is required by firefox I'm given a pop-up with a choice of installs to use but none of them work. It always says 'Cannot find plug-in 'insert plug-in name here'.' I tried downloading java from the java.com site, tried download one of the plug-in's from their site and nothing has worked. Someone help me ?

item.title: Ubuntu java problem

item.description:

It’s k. I just upgraded form gutsy gibbon to hardy heron (7.1 - 8.04)

sudo apt-get install ubuntu-restricted-extras

I’m trying to install the java plugin into firefox on ubuntu, when the java plugin is required by firefox I’m given a pop-up with a choice of installs to use but none of them work. It always says ‘Cannot find plug-in ‘insert plug-in name here’.’ I tried downloading java from the java.com site, tried download one of the plug-in’s from their site and nothing has worked.
